title: Byron Bay Espresso Bar
excerpt: Byron Bay, the bustling coastal town in NSW, is home to our latest espresso bar.
content:
Already we have such strong connections with cafes serving our coffee on this coast and with the inspiring lifestyle Byron Bay offers – think long days surfing, eating, and being part of great community – it was the perfect fit. Focusing on doing one thing well means our coffee drinkers have the chance to learn more about us, beyond a great cup of joe.

Our small team of four cover customer service, training, technical, sales and a retail space. From our Byron Bay Espresso Bar, we look after customers from the Gold Coast down to the Coffs Harbour region. Often you’ll find members of the team calling cafes for their weekly order, hand delivering coffee or jumping in to help if our customers are caught in a busy spell. The space also lends itself to a training room in the afternoon, training local baristas serving our coffee – just another way we can help support the community.

We have a small selection of blends available to buy for your next adventure, or to enjoy at home on a sleepy Sunday – Carmelo, Organic and a rotating blend or single origin. Never brewed specialty coffee at home? We can help you with the right equipment and teach you the tricks of the trade to steer you in the right direction. Chats and delicious brews await – pop in next time!

subtitle: Our Roastery in Freemans Bay, Auckland gives you the sensation that you’re really at the beating heart of all things Allpress Espresso.
more_content:
The Allpress Studio is another big part of the commitment we have to people, community, creativity and coffee. Attached to our Caffetteria, the open studio acts as a blank canvas where designers, artists and community groups come to share their work and tell their own stories. From leading New Zealand artists to new emerging talent, the Allpress Studio connects visitors directly to the talent behind the work. Its a hive of creative discussion and inspiration, which we believe goes hand in hand with our coffee. The studio is ever-changing, so each time you pop by there is bound to be inspiration found from whichever designer, artist or group is exhibiting in our space. It’s all about connectivity.

And speaking of connectivity, we have a particular connection at Allpress that plays a big role in our own story. The La Marzocco connection is a big thing for us and it all started, like most Allpress things do, with Michael’s quest for the perfect cup. Since 1927 La Marzocco of Florence, Italy have been handcrafting espresso machines, acclaimed internationally for their reliability and superior engineering. La Marzocco’s dual-boiler technology is key to preparing the perfect cup, so naturally, we feel La Marzocco and Allpress are a match made in espresso heaven.

Across the road from Browns Mill through the Jason Woodside mural on an unsuspecting garage door is where our technical team resides. They’re La Marzocco masters. They understand that maintaining a perfectly running espresso machine is essential for the best tasting coffee and running our own roastery cafés, we know that a busy café can afford no downtime. That’s why our technicians Kelly, Jade & Shrek are ready at any moment to help if a machine starts to splatter, leak or hiss in an unusual way. (We’re all guilty of doing that from time to time).

title: Auckland Roastery
excerpt: Our Roastery in Freemans Bay, Auckland gives you the sensation that you’re really at the beating heart of all things Allpress Espresso.
content:
Nestled on Drake Street, just a stone’s throw away from Victoria Park where Michael Allpress first opened the Allpress Coffee Carts in 1986, Browns Mill is a perfect fusion of what we’re all about – people, community, creativity and coffee. It’s a piece of our history that we love to share with our community. Time spent in the Browns Mill site makes for a truly Allpress experience.

Our roastery is just as much our space as it is your space. We’re all about immersing ourselves and others in our story. When you visit Browns Mill, take the chance to ask to have a look through where our roasting magic happens. Since back in 1986, we’ve been non-stop crafting the way in which we roast. Many things have changed since ’86, but we’ve been on one constant and committed journey. We’re always striving for the ultimate espresso – even if that means inventing our own magnificent hot air roasters – which Michael Allpress and technical engineer Michael Scobie successfully did in 2011. Our prototype sits proudly in Browns Mill, roasting six days a week and supplying beautiful coffee to the North Island of New Zealand.

The master craftsman behind our coffee, Craig Campbell, is responsible for all things flavour. And we don’t use the word master lightly. Over the past 20 years, Craig has devoted hours and hours, days on days, to cupping (coffee-speak for tasting). His ability to know how to adjust the origins in the blend, the roast temperature means we can be sure that the rich, multi-layered flavour you taste in your cup is consistent every time you sip an Allpress Espresso.

Our hands-on approach to running our Caffetteria provides us with the tool set we need in order to grasp the various needs of the cafés we partner with – we care about everything we touch. Alongside offering our famous Rangitoto Blend, a complete selection of all our beautiful coffee blends are available at Caffetteria to enjoy through filter, including our rotating single origin. As you sip your brew, don’t be shy about asking our team what lies behind the doors at Caffetteria, what that gentle humming is or where the beans lining the back wall come from. That’s our roastery. We’re proud of it and the history it holds, and we’d love to introduce the two of you.

subtitle: In 2002 Michael Allpress partnered with Tony Papas and together they opened the doors to Allpress Espresso’s first Australian Roastery & Café in the industrial suburb, Zetland. Quickly, it became a must-visit destination and coffee drinkers would come from far and wide to get their daily fix and their freshly roasted beans for the week.
more_content:
Beyond the bustle of coffee and food being served, and through the glass window is the large operational area of the roaster. Much like our other Roasteries, Sydney offers an open invite to come and learn more about the liquid gold in your cup. Coffee drinkers are often drawn to the entrance of the roastery, and then invited in by one of the team. Inside the distribution area sits our completely reconditioned Hot Air Roaster, our cupping room, and our roastery team packing coffee for our customers. From here, our coffee is either hand delivered to customers in the inner-city, or couriered out daily to the rest of our customers within NSW.

The tech team are all skilled on the tools and can be found repairing machines in our mezzanine workshop or out on the road installing and servicing our customers beautiful La Marzocco machines. On the top level at 58 Epsom Road, is our training room. That’s where we teach all the passionate locals who are serving our coffee. Our Perfect Cup Class is just another step that we take to ensure the flavour in your cup is consistent.
title: Sydney Roastery
excerpt: The building itself is defined by the rich brown exterior and stylish street level entrance to the café. Inside it’s lined with beautiful wooden floors, …
content:
The building itself is defined by the rich brown exterior and stylish street level entrance to the café. Inside it’s lined with beautiful wooden floors, rich timber fittings, large mirrors and the smell of delicious freshly roasted coffee.

Our cafe customers can enjoy our Allpress Espresso Blend through espresso, or a pour-over of any of our others. Our full range of freshly roasted blends and rotating single origin coffees are also available to purchase for brewing at home – whether it’s for espresso, plunger or anything in-between.

title: Allpress Christchurch
excerpt: An old steelworks warehouse in Montreal Street is where you’ll find us in Christchurch.
content:
Each day you’ll see an eclectic mix of people, from tradies who leave their shoes at the door, to young students drawing plans for their latest architecture assignment, all wanting to find a place to breathe and connect over a flat white.

The building refurbishment draws on unique design details seen in our other Roasteries around the world – mint tiles shipped in from Japan, large windows paired with lots of glass to let light in, and beautiful timber finishings. It’s an all encompassing base for us, our customers, and coffee drinkers alike.

Under Montreal Streets high-angled ceilings you’ll find our café, distribution centre, technical workshop and, of course, plenty of coffee. The café offers a wide range of fare too – from traditional Italian style sandwiches to beautiful salads – and cheese rolls, of course. Almost everything is made in house, right down to the sauces, and our bread is freshly baked by one of our customers just down the road.

And don’t worry that there’s no roaster to be seen, our beans are shipped fresh from our Dunedin Roastery every day. And they’re Hot Air Roasted to perfection. We offer our full range of blends – from the lighter Full City, to our rich Supremo Blend. You can enjoy them through a delicious pour-over, or buy them to brew in the comfort of your undies at home.

From Montreal Street we provide technical service for all our customers in the South Island – from Cob & Lobster Nelson, to Vudu Café & Larder in Queenstown. Being in Christchurch has allowed us to be closer to our customers and provide better support for them, including on-site training, technical servicing and hand delivering coffee to those nearby.

subtitle: The idea behind Allpress Coffee, our retail store on Ponsonby Road, is simple.
more_content:
Our store customers can enjoy an expertly prepared Allpress Espresso Blend coffee or single origin filter brew. Complementing the coffee is a small selection of European inspired biscuits, prepared and baked in Biscotto Bakery the pristine white-tiled space that extends into the back half of the store.

Coffee classes are held after hours in-store for coffee enthusiasts keen to develop coffee preparation skills and extend their knowledge of coffee.

title: Allpress Coffee Ponsonby
excerpt: The idea behind Allpress Coffee, our retail store on Ponsonby Road, is simple.
content:
Your local bakery supplies freshly baked bread, the florist delivers beautiful flowers, the produce store has the juiciest fruit and Allpress Coffee has freshly roasted coffee, ready for you to enjoy at home or off the beaten track.

You will find an Allpress Espresso Bar within many of the communities we serve, from Christchurch in New Zealand, to Redchurch in London. Much more than just a stop for a takeaway coffee, they are spaces where we can connect with the local community and where we aim to create a welcoming work space that seamlessly combines the Allpress elements. No secrets, just us, for all to see.

Allpress Coffee is a place where tasting and discovering coffee is welcomed so choosing your coffee to brew at home becomes selective and not a guess, and where we can ignite a broader appreciation and understanding of beautiful coffee beyond the much loved espresso.

subtitle: Why Dunedin? To which we always said, why not?
more_content:
Our people are really what sets Allpress apart. And this rings especially true in Dunedin where we’re lucky to have a small team of passionate locals running the show. These people are good people, who love good people. And it’s why we love them. The Allpress Dunedin crew are genuinely invested in our coffee, our customers and having a sense of pride about their jobs. And a sense of humour, which helps.

Our roastery café in Dunedin is a place to look around, truly understand what goes into your morning cup and to slow down. After all – life is never best when experienced at a frenetic pace and we believe people are always much better for taking a moment to recharge.

title: Dunedin Roastery
excerpt: Why Dunedin? To which we always said, why not?
content:
It’s in our blood to find our own feet in unusual places and what might be the not-so-obvious, to us is sometimes the most obvious.

Since the gold rush of the 19th century, Dunedin has always had a strong café culture. It’s one of the reasons we decided to go south but our connection ran a bit deeper – Mike’s father, Bruce Allpress, is originally from Dunedin and we wanted to be closer to our growing South Island customer base. Mainly though, it just felt right. When we opened in 2011, we were welcomed with open arms by the local community and even now when you enter the café you’ll notice our regulars, from all aspects of Dunedin life, who seem very at home in our little, honest café.

The building itself, like others around the city, had many past lives. What the world saw was an old automotive workshop, we saw a home for Allpress Espresso. Returning the building to some of its original glory was an obvious choice – what is left is a space filled with natural light, warm timber finishes, an industrial feel… and a giant Allpress Hot Air Roaster. Michael Allpress partnered with Michael Scobie, a technical engineer. With their combined talents, Mike & Mike set to building their own roaster, customised for flavour first. The result, ART – Air Roasting Technologies, sits proudly through a glass wall in our Dunedin Roastery. You can’t help but admire the simplicity of the machine – beans rotating in a stream of hot air, with no risk of scorching which elevates natural sweetness to achieve the long lasting flavour that Allpress Espresso is known for.
